channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: “No more Minnesota nice, Minneapolis will strike”
item.description: It was too cold to take off my mittens and check Google Maps so I put my faith in the trickle of bundled-up people ahead of me. All of them were carrying signs and wearing whistles around their necks on top of layers and layers of winter clothing. At first there were dozens of us […]

item.title: Study: Used EVs Are The Cheapest Vehicles To Own
item.description: A lot of people leased EVs three years ago, and now they're turning them in. You should probably buy one.

item.title: Onnit's Instant Melatonin Spray Keeps Bedtime Uncomplicated
item.description: Just spritz and sleep—no melatonin tablets or pills necessary.

item.title: HBO Knows ‘It: Welcome to Derry’ Should Get a Season 2
item.description: If you're wanting more 'Welcome to Derry,' you better hope the Muschiettis come up with a good enough reason to take you back to town.

item.title: Don’t You Dare ‘Misinterpret’ Elon Musk’s Epstein Emails. Just the Facts Are Bad Enough
item.description: Sorry, but what is the correct interpretation supposed to be?

item.title: SpaceX wants to put 1 million solar-powered data centers into orbit
item.description: SpaceX filed a request with the FCC on Friday seeking approval to put a constellation of 1 million data center satellites into orbit. While the FCC is unlikely to approve a network that expansive, SpaceX's strategy has been to request approval for unrealistically large numbers of satellites as a starting point for negotiations. The filing […]

item.title: No, it’s not the latest games console - AtomMan G7 Pro mini PC from Minisforum goes on sale with a Core i9-14900HX and RTX 5070 in a super slim chassis, but you might be better off buying a Dell
item.description: Minisforum AtomMan G7 Pro delivers Core i9-14900HX performance in a super slim mini PC design.

item.title: Microsoft has finally fixed a bizarre issue that saw it reroute traffic to an obscure Japanese company - so what exactly went wrong?
item.description: Microsoft’s email autoconfiguration routed example.com traffic to Japanese servers, exposing long-standing gaps in oversight and configuration control.

item.title: OnlyFans is reportedly in talks to sell a 60 percent stake to a San Francisco investment firm
item.description: OnlyFans is looking to cash out once again, but this time in a deal that would value it at several billion dollars less than a potential sale that previously fell through. As reported by TechCrunch, the online platform known for subscription-based pornographic content is in talks to sell a majority stake to Architect Capital, an investment firm based in San Francisco. According to the report, the proposed deal includes $3.5 billion in equity and $2 billion in debt, which values OnlyFans at $5.5 billion. TechCrunch also reported that Architect Capital and OnlyFans are currently in exclusive tal...

item.title: La voiture électrique jugée supérieure, des améliorations de Google Maps et de Waze, et les galères de Volkswagen sur le logiciel Rivian – Récap’ Survoltés
item.description: La semaine du 26 janvier 2026 fut dense dans l'actualité des vélos et voitures électriques, entre un constat implacable de Volvo, une évolution de Google Maps utile pour les vélos, l'évolution de l'autonomie au fil du temps et un logiciel Volkswagen pas évident. C'est l'heure du Récap' Survoltés.

item.title: Give your kitchen a spring glow-up with these butter yellow accessories from IKEA – all under $20
item.description: This collection of sunny tableware and lighting accessories will chase away the winter blues, with prices starting from just $1.99.

item.title: Most RAG systems don’t understand sophisticated documents — they shred them
item.description: By now, many enterprises have deployed some form of RAG. The promise is seductive: index your PDFs, connect an LLM and instantly democratize your corporate knowledge.But for industries dependent on heavy engineering, the reality has been underwhelming. Engineers ask specific questions about infrastructure, and the bot hallucinates.The failure isn't in the LLM. The failure is in the preprocessing.Standard RAG pipelines treat documents as flat strings of text. They use "fixed-size chunking" (cutting a document every 500 characters). This works for prose, but it destroys the logic of technical ma...

item.title: Avis aux joueurs occasionnels, cet écran PC MSI de 24,5″ et 100 Hz est soldé à moins de 70 €
item.description: Le MSI Pro MP252 est un écran présenté comme un moniteur bureautique, pourtant il cache quelques atouts capables de séduire les joueurs au budget serré. Simple et efficace, il fait le job là où on l'attend. Et pour la dernière ligne droite des soldes, son prix chute de 99,99 euros à 69,99 euros sur Amazon.
